alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 8:11PM EDT until July 02 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN NEW CASTLE COUNTY... At 810 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Pike Creek, or near Newark, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. At 8:01 PM, multiple trees were reported down along Route 896 in Landenberg, PA. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Elsmere, New Castle, Newport, Greenville, Stanton, North Star, Talleyville, Wilmington Manor, Pike Creek, Hockessin, Ashland, Bellefonte, Edgemoor, Claymont and Brookside. This includes Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 7 and 20. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
